subject: Our Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Our Dear Beneficiary,
I hope this email meets you and your family well? I am writing to let you know that We have received an email again today from Mr. Michael Francisco and his friend Mr.George Morgan Richard. who claimed that you sent them to contact me and that you gave  them your power of attorney to make claims of your funds $16,000,000.00 Sixteen Million United states of American Dollars.
 
According to their report they told me that you told them that you are not capable of completing your transfer transaction any more due to the COVID-19 (CORONAVIRUS) you have been affected with for over a year plus now.
 
They are requesting that we transfer your funds $16,000,000.00 to their giving account and they promise to pay for the balance and also pay for documents for the exchange of ownership so that we will be able to wire transfer your funds to them. They however pledged to compensate you with $7500.00 only once the funds reflected into their designated Bank accounts.
 
They said that you gave them this office email address to contact us and let us know that you are the one who gave your power of attorney to make the claim on your behalf.I am writing to confirm from you of this report before we could proceed with their request.
 Therefore, your urgent reply will definitely help us in this issue.
 
Yours Faithfully
Christopher A. Wray
E-mail: 
fbi1@songwriter.net
Incumbent Director General Federal Bureau

subject: Re: Our Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello A. Wray,

I hope this message finds you in good health. I'm a bit surprised by the information you've shared with me about Mr. Michael Francisco and Morgan Richard claiming to have my power of attorney. It's quite an interesting situation, isn't it?

Could you please provide more details about how they got in touch with you? And what exactly did they say about my health condition? I'm curious to know more.

Also, could you clarify what kind of documents they are planning to pay for? It seems like a significant step, doesn't it?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Tommie

subject: Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie 
 
 I received your email with joy, and in response to your questions, this men contacted me on email and they said that you gave them the power to contact as your representative to claim your total funds into their bank own bank account that you were very sick as a result of corona virus you have been affected with. 
 
 the documents they were planning to secure is the change of ownership affidvate , and also pay for administrative and funds transfer endorsement certificate. please sir, I want to confirm from you if know them if you are the one that authorized this move. 
 
 
 
  
 Mr. Christopher A Wray 
 ncumbent Director General Federal Bureau of Investigation 
 since August 2, 2017 
 
 
 Sent: Thursday, February 08, 2024 at 8:54 PM From: "Tommie" <ae18138@***.com> To: fbi1@songwriter.net Subject: Re: Our Dear Beneficiary, 
 
Hello A. Wray, 
I hope this message finds you in good health. I'm a bit surprised by the information you've shared with me about Mr. Michael Francisco and Morgan Richard claiming to have my power of attorney. It's quite an interesting situation, isn't it? 
Could you please provide more details about how they got in touch with you? And what exactly did they say about my health condition? I'm curious to know more. 
Also, could you clarify what kind of documents they are planning to pay for? It seems like a significant step, doesn't it? 
Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
Best wishes, 
Tommie

subject: Re: Re: Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:

2 with the administrative and authorization means that they have the legal rights to have the funds wire transferred into their designated bank account. And concerned about your details reconfirmation I assure it will keep private as I cannot share your privacy with anyone except the bank here that will handle the transfer into your bank account. However, you can hold on and you forward it directly to bank when it's time for you to do so. 

Thanks and remain blessed.

The process will start by you reconfirming your details to the bank, then let them know if you would like to receive your payment via wire transfer into your bank account or you will prefer to download the total funds into an ATM card.

After this you will be required to get the documents for the transfer and I am sure they will help you secure the documents through their lawyer. So that it will not cost you much and I think that's all.

The bank will immediately switch on to process and complete the payment depending on your choice whether direct wire transfer into your bank account or an ATM card which you will be using to withdraw your money they will let you know the daily withdrawal limit.

Thanks and remain blessed
Yours sincerely
FBI

I have explained to you about the security measures, don't disclose or share your pin code with anyone.you will also get debit or credit notification immediately a transaction is made and you are the only person that receives this alert notification that's good security.

I have given you every assurance that you need and it stands. Come on you don't need to be scared of anything because your full details will be confidential and private it's not to be public okay sir. I really understand your point sir. But believe what I have told you sir 

You just have to keep everything secret till the total funds entered into your possession, because not everyone who claimed to be your friend will be happy for your success.

Good bye for now and remain blessed.

body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a very convenient way to access funds. I'm just curious, how does the ATM machine know it's me? Is there some sort of special technology involved?

Also, you mentioned about getting documents. What kind of documents are these and why do they cost money? 

I appreciate your assurance about the security measures. It's comforting to know that my details will be kept private.

You're right, not everyone who claims to be a friend is truly happy for one's success. That's a wise observation.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Tommie

subject: Re: Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Thank you Dear Tommie,

Yes, in ATM withdrawal there's always a daily withdrawal limit, but it's the bank will regulate this because it will be based on the total funds. It will not be an issue at all.

I'm not in the position to tell you the exact information the bank will require from you while contacting you.
Regards
Mr. Christopher.

subject: : : Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
My dear Tommie,

Yes, it's convenient and the ATM machine only confirms to be the owner to account funds because once you insert the ATM and immediately request you to input the pin and it's done correctly.

The documents are your transfer documents and transfer  payment paperwork.it usually cost money because it will must be approved sign and stamped.

subject: Re: : : Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Hello Tommie,

Thank you for your explanation. It's fascinating how the ATM machine works, isn't it? I never really thought about it before, but it makes sense that the machine needs to confirm the owner of the account funds.

As for the transfer documents, I see what you mean. There must be a lot of steps involved in making sure everything is approved and stamped correctly. Could you tell me more about this process? How does it work exactly?

And just out of curiosity, are there any other costs associated with transfers that I should be aware of?

Best wishes,
Tommie

subject: Re: Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Dullard

P.S. I'm curious, why do you ask about ATM withdrawal limits? Are you planning to make a large withdrawal soon?

Tommie

subject: Re: Re: : : Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Good day to you sir Tommie,

I hope you are doing great? Yes, without the pin being your security code the ATM machine will not pay out any money to you sir.

That's exactly what I was trying to let you know, but it will not take a lot of steps and there's no much protocol process involved okay  like as I told you it will not exceed 4 to 5 working days.

Finally sir, there will no other cost attached for the transfer just to obtain the transfer paperwork.

Remain blessed
Mr Christopher

subject: Re: Re: Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Dear Sir,

I don't have any pedigree of any right to demand or request for a withdrawal limit on your ATM card. I only said that the bank will inform you how much would be your daily withdrawal limit.

You can as well request from them to let you know.

Do have a great day ahead
Regards
Mr. Christopher

subject: : Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Attention dear Tommie

I'm glad that you and your family were all in the good spirit.

 I mean what  exactly do you want me to clarify you about?  

Well, I just wanted to know if you have had any communication with the bank? Nevertheless I believe by Monday or Tuesday next week since we are already on weekend the bank will contact you. Better still, you have the right to email the bank with their email address that I sent to you. I don't really have any specific questions or matters I need us to discuss.
Regards
Mr Christopher

subject: Re: : Re:  Attention Dear  Beneficiary Tommie, Urgent Message.
body:
Hello Tommie,

I hope this message finds you and your family in good health and high spirits. I'm here to provide any information or clarification you might need.

You mentioned something about the bank? Are you expecting some communication from them? If so, it's likely that they will reach out to you early next week since the weekend is upon us. However, if there's anything urgent, feel free to contact them directly using the email address provided earlier.

Is there anything else you'd like to discuss or any other questions you have? I'm here to help!

Best wishes,
Tommie

body:

Tommie
